The paper proposes a method for recognizing actions in static images by hallucinating the unobserved future motion. This involves learning a prior over short-term dynamics from unlabeled videos, inferring the anticipated optical flow on novel static images, and training discriminative models that exploit both streams of information. The approach involves the use of an encoder-decoder convolutional neural network and a novel optical flow encoding. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves the use of machine learning techniques such as deep learning, which suggests that it could also belong to the Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. The paper also deals with multimedia (cs.MM) and robotics (cs.RO) applications, as it aims to recognize actions and dynamic scenes.
